### Royalty Case Management Expansion

#### Background
Petrolium and Gas Canada (PGC) is a government agency dedicated to managing and administering oil and gas resources on First Nation reserve lands. The agency is part of the Lands and Economic Development Sector of Indigenous Services Canada (ISC). As part of its operations, PGC maintains three IT systems: Resource Information Management System 1 (RIMS1), Royalty Management (RM) System, and Royalty Case Management (RCM) system.

#### Objectives
The primary goal of this contract is to expand the RCM system to include additional enforcement tiers and compliance activities for other business units of PGC. The expanded RCM system will track non-compliance of royalty obligations and provide a more comprehensive framework for enforcing compliance.

#### Scope of Work
The successful contractor will provide IT services on an as-needed basis, as detailed in Task Authorizations (TA) issued by the Technical Authority. The contractor will be responsible for building additional tiers to the RCM system, including data exchange with RM, RIMS1, or other systems, and integration with Outlook, GCDocs, or other systems as required. The contractor will also provide reporting capabilities, including summary reports to be shared with First Nations summarizing outstanding non-compliance issues on their lands.

#### Requirements
The contractor must have experience in the following categories: Programmer/Software Developer (Level 2 and 3), Business Analyst (Level 3), Business Process Re-engineering Consultant (Level 2), Technical Writer (Level 2), Project Manager (Level 3), and Quality Assurance Specialist/Analyst (Level 2).

#### Invitation to Tender
This contract is open only to those TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders who qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Zone Region. The following companies have been invited to submit a proposal: Acosys Consulting Services Inc., Akkodis Canada Inc., Alika Internet Technologies Inc., and others.

#### Contract Details
The contract duration will be 18 months from the date of contract award. The contractor must meet the minimum security requirements, including Reliability and Protected B.
